be.pxl.games.mastermind.model

Interface MasterMindGame


  • public interface MasterMindGame
    This interface defines a 'Master Mind' game. The game chooses a random combination of 4 colors out of 6 possible colors: black, cyan, green, red, yellow and white. The player has to guess this combination. After each guess the game tells the player the number of correct colors and the number of correct colors on the right place. The player has ten chances to guess the combination. The game ends in case the player guesses the combination or the maximum number of trials has been reached. This game should be used in the following sequence:
    1. start()
    2. guess()
      3. (several times until the combination is guessed or the maximum number of trials (10) has been reached. Typically guessing is performed in the following while loop:
      while(game.getState()== State.PLAYING) {
         Guess guess = new Guess();
         ... // Set guess values
         Result result = game.guess(guess);
         ... // Handle result
      }
    3. getCombination()
    You can check wether the combination was guessed by calling isGuessed() < br /> Have a lot of fun!
    Author:
    Noël Vaes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color[] getCombination()
      Returns the right combination.
      State getState()
      Returns the state of the game.
      Result guess(Guess guess)
      Make a guess of the combination.
      boolean isGuessed()
      Returns the guess status.
      void start()
      Starts the game.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the game. A new combination is calculated which the player has to guess. If a previous game has not been finished, the game is reset.

      • guess

        Result guess(Guess guess)
        Make a guess of the combination. The method start() should have been called first.
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess.
        Returns:
        The result of the guess. null if the game hasn't been started yet or has already finished.

      • getState

        State getState()
        Returns the state of the game.
        Returns:
        The state

      • getCombination

        Color[] getCombination()
        Returns the right combination. If the game is still in the PLAYING state, the game will be finished and enter the State#FINISHED state.
        Returns:
        The right combination.

      • isGuessed

        boolean isGuessed()
        Returns the guess status.
        Returns:
        true if combination is guessed.
